Created attachment 550314
FF print zoom bug.zip

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

1. View attached Print.htm.
2. Change Page Setup to landscape.
3. Print.


Actual results:

Second reference to image c.png appears on a second printed page, although you can see by the appearance of "Heading" that Firefox is getting partly getting it right.


Expected results:

It should all have printed on a single page, with room to spare (letter or A4).  Note the -moz-transform being applied, which works fine on screen.

comments.text:
Hi AndreiD, thanks for looking into this.  

>But it's still unclear whether it should not display in 2 pages.

You should see on the printout that there is plenty of room for the second green box (same size as first) to fit (centred) under "Heading", without impinging on the right or bottom margin, which would force a page break.  Cut it out of the second page and place it to see.

On my printer Firefox seems to be printing at 96dpi, hence the right edge of the second rectangle should be at:

12.7[left margin] + (300[left] + 705[image width px]/96*25.4)/2[zoom]
 = 256mm

bottom edge of same rectangle should be at:

12.7[top margin] + (200[top] + 250[image height px]/96*25.4)/2[zoom]
 = 146mm + a bit for "Heading", table padding, etc

For A4 paper, the right and bottom margins should be at 284 and 197mm.  For letter, 267 and 203mm.  Either way, the green rectangle should fit.
